intro: Meibomia adscendens, commonly known as the climbing meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a prominent yellow gland at the base. Meibomia adscendens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
